item.title: 中东股市因石油和关税冲击遭遇 2020 年以来最惨重跌势
item.description: 由于投资者对全球贸易战和油价低迷的双重威胁做出了反应，包括沙特阿拉伯在内的中东国家主要股票基准在周日创下了 2020 年以来的最大跌幅。【原文：Main equity benchmarks in Middle East countries including Saudi Arabia sank the most since 2020 on Sunday as investors reacted to the dual threats of a global trade war and depressed oil prices.】

item.title: Meta 宣布发布新的 Llama 4 人工智能模型
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司宣布推出新的 Llama 4 人工智能模型，使用户能够构建更加个性化的 "多模态 "体验。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. announced the release of its new Llama 4 artificial intelligence models that allow users to build more personalized “multimodal” experiences.】

item.title: 斯塔默誓言采取措施支持英国企业应对关税威胁
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）表示，在唐纳德-特朗普的关税威胁下，他将于本周宣布支持英国经济和企业的措施。【原文：UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he’ll announce measures this week to support Britain’s economy and businesses amid the threat posed by Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 香港财务总监称关税威胁全球贸易
item.description: 香港财政司司长陈茂波周日在一篇博客文章中说，美国的关税破坏了国际贸易，并将最终伤害美国人。【原文：US tariffs undermine international trade and will ultimately hurt Americans, Hong Kong Financial Secretary Paul Chan said in a blog post Sunday.】

item.title: 不要出卖英国儿童作为关税谈判筹码
item.description:
英国政府正在考虑重新审议《网络安全法案》，以此作为对唐纳德-特朗普的让步。这将是一个错误。【原文：

The UK government is considering reviewing the Online Safety Act as a concession to Donald Trump. That would be a mistake.

】

item.title: 英国公司可从特朗普关税中获得竞争优势
item.description: 经济学家认为，唐纳德-特朗普对英国出口产品的优惠待遇为英国企业带来了竞争优势，可以保护英国经济免受华盛顿贸易战最严重影响。【原文：Donald Trump’s preferential treatment of British exports gives the country’s firms a competitive advantage that could protect the economy from the worst of Washington’s trade war, according to economists.】

item.title: 中国投资者为美国关税报复的 "丑陋 "周一做好准备
item.description: 随着中国市场结束了一个漫长的周末，并考虑到对美国关税的报复，中国投资者正准备迎接一个严峻的周一。【原文：China investors are bracing for a grim Monday as the nation’s markets return from an extended weekend and factor in its retaliation to US tariffs.】

item.title: 基辅市长称俄罗斯发动导弹袭击，基辅发生爆炸
item.description: 基辅市市长维塔利-克里琴科（Vitali Klitschko）说，俄罗斯对基辅发动了导弹袭击，更多的射弹正在逼近。【原文：Russia launched a missile attack on Kyiv, and more of the projectiles are approaching, the city’s mayor Vitali Klitschko said.】

item.title: 美国加征关税前越南第一季度经济增长放缓
item.description: 越南第一季度的经济增长速度低于经济学家的预测，因为该国正准备应对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁未来增长的 46%关税。【原文：Vietnam’s economy expanded slower than economists’ forecast in the first quarter as the country braces for Donald Trump’s 46% tariff that threatens future growth.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司更接近在关键近海区域进行钻探
item.description: 巴西国家控制的石油生产商巴西石油公司（Petroleo Brasileiro SA）表示，该公司已经完成了一个野生动物救援中心的建设，标志着该公司在该国北部州近海一个前景广阔但却充满争议的地区打出了第一口探井。【原文：Brazil’s state-controlled oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA said it has finished building a wildlife rescue center, marking a step toward its first exploratory well in a promising yet contentious region offshore the country’s Northern state.】

item.title: 美国通胀将预示特朗普关税带来的痛苦
item.description: 美国家庭上个月的总体通胀率可能略有下降，经济学家认为，在唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税海啸之后，这种缓和是暂时的。【原文：US households probably experienced slightly less overall inflation last month, a reprieve that economists view as temporary in the wake of President Donald Trump’s tariff tsunami.】

item.title: 法国总理称美国关税可能使法国国内生产总值减少超过半个百分点
item.description: 法国总理弗朗索瓦-巴伊鲁（Francois Bayrou）在接受《巴黎人报》（Le Parisien）采访时说，美国对法国征收关税可能会使法国的经济产出下降半个多百分点，并使弥补预算赤字的努力脱轨。【原文：US tariffs on France could cost the country more than half a point off its economic output and derail efforts to close the budget deficit, French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou said in an interview with Le Parisien newspaper published late Saturday.】

item.title: 法国称欧盟对特朗普的回应可能涉及大科技公司的数据使用问题
item.description: 法国财政部长在接受《JDD》报采访时说，欧盟对美国关税的回应可能包括监管美国大型科技集团对数据的使用。【原文：The European Union’s response to US tariffs could include regulating the use of data by American big tech groups, France’s finance minister said in an interview with the JDD newspaper.】

item.title: 关税引发洪债务卷土重来的担忧
item.description: 杠杆融资交易停滞不前，市场受到冲击，银行有可能再次陷入为收购而举债的困境。【原文：Deals in leveraged finance have stalled, and markets have been upended, raising the possibility that banks might once again get stuck with debt they’ve committed for acquisitions.】

item.title: 贝森特在关税问题上充当二传手，华尔街遭受粗暴冲击
item.description: 从唐纳德-特朗普总统周三公布全面关税的那一刻起，到次日随之而来的市场混乱，财政部长斯科特-贝森特的手机就被与他以前的行业有关的高管发来的短信打爆了。【原文：From the moment President Donald Trump unveiled his sweeping tariffs Wednesday through the ensuing market mayhem the following day, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s phone lit up with text messages from executives tied to his former industry.】

item.title: 内塔尼亚胡将于周一与特朗普会谈关税、加沙和伊朗问题
item.description: 一位以色列官员说，本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理将于周一在华盛顿会见美国总统唐纳德-特朗普，为以色列寻求更好的关税协议，并讨论加沙战争、叙利亚局势和伊朗核计划。【原文：Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will meet on Monday with President Donald Trump in Washington to seek a better tariff deal for Israel and to discuss the war in Gaza, the situation in Syria and the Iranian nuclear program, an Israeli official said.】

item.title: 马斯克希望美欧建立零关税自由贸易区
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）希望在美国和欧洲之间建立一个 "零关税 "体系，这将有效地创建一个 "自由贸易区"。【原文：Elon Musk hopes for a “zero-tariff” system between the US and Europe that would effectively create “a free trade zone,” he told attendees of a League event in Italy, days after levies set by US President Donald Trump sent global markets into a tailspin.】

item.title: 中国承诺采取坚决措施回击特朗普关税
item.description: 在宣布对美国商品征税和稀土出口管制以回应唐纳德-特朗普的关税之后一天，中国承诺采取果断行动捍卫本国经济。【原文：China pledged decisive action to defend its economy, a day after unveiling levies on American goods and export controls on rare earths in response to Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 特朗普承诺制造业繁荣。各行各业并不确定
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统曾信誓旦旦地表示，他的历史性关税闪电战将重振国内制造业，但业界对他的做法感到担忧，使人们对他能否兑现经济繁荣的承诺产生了新的怀疑。【原文：President Donald Trump has vowed his historic tariff blitz would revive domestic manufacturing, but industry worries about his approach are raising fresh doubts about whether he can deliver on his promise of an economic boom.】

item.title: 保守党承诺加拿大企业将减少 25% 的繁文缛节
item.description: 保守党领袖皮埃尔-波利瓦尔（Pierre Poilievre）在 4 月 28 日大选前向企业界发出的最新呼吁中，承诺将加拿大经济从 "红头文件引发的沉睡 "中唤醒。【原文：Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre promised to wake up the Canadian economy from the “red-tape-induced slumber” in his latest pitch to businesses ahead of the April 28 election.】

item.title: 欧佩克+委员会重申必须遵守石油产出配额
item.description: 欧佩克+"主要成员国重申，在该组织出人意料地决定加快恢复产量后，成员国必须遵守石油产量配额，这使原油价格受到打击。【原文：Key OPEC+ nations reiterated the need for members to stick to oil output quotas after the group’s surprise decision to speed up an output revival battered crude prices.】

item.title: 灰姑娘寥寥无几，体育博彩公司的疯狂三月盈利岌岌可危
item.description: 今年的 "疯狂三月 "除了疯狂还是疯狂。【原文：This year’s March Madness was anything but mad.】

item.title: 特朗普称中国遭受的打击比美国严重，并吹捧投资
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周六在其社交媒体平台 "真理社交"（Truth Social）上发文称，美国正在 "前所未有地带回就业和企业"。【原文：President Donald Trump said the US is “bringing back jobs and businesses like never before,” according to a post on his social media platform Truth Social on Saturday.】

item.title: 特朗普关税的 "乌鸦嘴 "与欧洲的不安全感
item.description:
美国总统特朗普本周震撼了经济和金融界

。【原文：

President Trump rocked the worlds of economy and finance this week 

】

item.title: 美国击败胡塞武装分子的进展仍不明朗
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普曾夸口说，他已经 "消灭 "了胡塞武装分子（Houthis），他们是伊朗支持的武装分子，自2023年以来一直袭击在红海过境的商船。但在美国空袭行动开始三周后，他的政府提供的有关部署武器和打击目标的证据有限，无法证明这一说法。【原文：President Donald Trump has boasted that he’s “decimated” the Houthis, the Iran-backed militants who have attacked commercial ships transiting the Red Sea since 2023. But three weeks into a campaign of US airstrikes, his administration has offered limited evidence of weapons deployed and targets hit to back up that assertion.】

item.title: 北京制定 "坚决措施 "回击特朗普关税
item.description: 中国对唐纳德-特朗普的最新关税进行了报复，对所有美国商品征收关税，并对稀土实行出口管制，中国国家媒体称之为 "坚决措施"，以维护世界第二大经济体的地位。【原文：China retaliated against Donald Trump’s latest tariffs with levies on all American goods as well as export controls on rare earths, in what state media termed “resolute measures” to safeguard the world’s number two economy.】

item.title: 欧洲央行施纳贝尔称特朗普的攻击可能标志着自由贸易的终结
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员伊莎贝尔-施纳贝尔（Isabel Schnabel）认为，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税攻势可能意味着全球自由贸易时代已经结束。【原文：European Central Bank Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel suggested that US President Donald Trump’s tariff onslaught may signify that the era of free-flowing global commerce is over.】

item.title: 美国工业 "黄金时代 "需要联邦支持
item.description: 美国邮政局上个月同意在 30 天内裁员 1 万人，这是特朗普政府缩减联邦政府规模和开支、为私营部门主导经济增长提供更大空间的广泛计划的一部分。【原文：The US Postal Service last month agreed to cut 10,000 people from its payrolls over a 30-day span, one component of a broad Trump administration plan to shrink the size and spending of the federal government and give greater space for private-sector led economic growth.】

item.title: 泰晤士报》称捷豹路虎将因关税问题暂停对美出口
item.description: 据英国《泰晤士报》报道，在唐纳德-特朗普政府征收关税后，英国汽车制造商捷豹路虎暂停向美国运输汽车。【原文：UK automaker Jaguar Land Rover is pausing shipments of its cars to the US following the introduction of tariffs by Donald Trump’s government, The Times newspaper reported.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：美国关税重创市场，展望未来
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在本周中对许多国家征收广泛的关税，这一惩罚性举措引发了巨大的冲击波，在企业董事会、金融市场和世界各国政府中产生了反响。【原文：President Donald’s Trump’s mid-week move to impose broad US tariffs — punishing for many countries — kicked off massive shock waves that reverberated through corporate boardrooms, financial markets and world governments.】
